intro: Sartwellia humilis, commonly known as the low sartwellia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Sartwellia humilis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species in the botanical world.
